variant.question: On a clear night, a Cargolux 777 freighter takes-off from King Khalid International Airport in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia. A short time after lift-off, climb performance is significantly worsened. What is the probable reason?

options.text: A strong temperature inversion
A severe downdraft
An extremely low relative humidity
Contamination such as sand and dust reducing engine performance

variant.question: The cause of the potential difference between the Earth and the atmosphere which causes thunder is:

options.text: The different distribution of electrically charged particles between the ground surface and the ionosphere.
Fair weather flow.
Local distribution of thunderstorms.
The Earth’s magnetic field.

variant.question: With some exceptions like El Niño / La Niña, the basic structure of the atmosphere remains more or less constant, because of the...

options.text: varying solar radiation, which is compensated by the different specific heat capacities of the continents and oceans.
long-lasting transport of heat from the equator to higher latitudes by ocean currents such as the Gulf Stream.
Coriolis force which is acting on the atmosphere, and the stable temperature profiles overhead the oceans.
rotation of the Earth, the regular movement of the air from high pressure areas to low pressure areas, and the different heating of the continents and oceans.

variant.question:
Refer to figure 050-122.
What type of lightning is represented in this picture?

options.text: Cloud to ground.
Intra cloud.
Cloud to cloud.
Cloud to air.

variant.question:
Refer to figure 050-121.
What type of lightning is represented in this picture?

options.text: Cloud to cloud
Cloud to air
Intra cloud
Cloud to ground

variant.question:
Refer to figure 050-119.
What type of lightning is represented in this picture?

options.text: Intra cloud
Cloud to air
Cloud to ground
Cloud to cloud

variant.question: Which of the following statements regarding an aircraft being struck by lightning is true?

options.text: The flight crew might have temporary difficulties in determining the current attitude of flight.
The dimension of the damage caused by the lightning stroke is reciprocally proportional to the strength of the electric field the aircraft intruded.
Though flying through an electric field, the aircraft itself is not a charge carrier and therefore it cannot initiate a lightning discharge.
An aircraft made of conductive material (e.g. metal) will generally suffer greater adverse effects due to lightning discharge than an aircraft made of non-conductive composite material.

variant.question: Which of the following statements regarding an aircraft being struck by lightning is true?

options.text: The flight crew might have temporary difficulties in determining the current attitude of flight.
The dimension of the damage caused by the lightning stroke is reciprocally proportional to the strength of the electric field the aircraft intruded.
Though flying through an electric field, the aircraft itself is not a charge carrier and therefore it cannot initiate a lightning discharge.

The crew of an aircraft made of conductive material (e.g. metal) will generally suffer greater adverse effects due to lightning discharge than the crew of an aircraft made of non-conductive composite material.

variant.question: What is correct regarding lightning? It is formed through an electrical charge:

options.text: Between the ground and a thunderstorm cloud or between the top and bottom of a cloud with different charges.
Between a warm, moist air mass and the colder surface.
Between the tops of two cumulonimbus clouds.
Between two warm, moist air masses.

variant.question:
The electric field in the atmosphere generates a significant potential difference between the Earth’s surface and the ionosphere. 
It is believed this is caused by....

options.text: The global distribution of thunderstorms.
Fair weather current flow.
The adiabatic process and the stability of the atmosphere.
The relative position of the Earth to the Sun.

variant.question: Mark the correct statement concerning lightning discharge

options.text: While flying through air that is electrically charged the aircraft is likely to become a charge carrier itself and can initiate a lightning discharge.
The set of possible effects of a lightning discharge does not include welding of aircraft parts such as joints or bearings.
The probability of a lightning discharge is reciprocally proportional to the strength of the electric field the aircraft intruded.
Because an aircraft acts as a “”Faraday`s cage””, the magnetisation associated with a lightning discharge hardly has an effect on the magnetic compass.

variant.question: What is true about the ‘St. Elmo’s fire’ weather phenomenon?

options.text: The St. Elmo's fire is a permanent electrical discharge in the air.
The St. Elmo's fire is caused by solar winds.
The St. Elmo's fire is a special lightning system for GPS approaches and departures.
The St. Elmo's fire is a flight hazard, consisting of several lightning strikes.

variant.question: Which of the following statements about lightning and lightning strikes is correct?

options.text: The aircraft is temporarily part of the lightning trajectory
Spherical lightning often penetrate into aircraft
Compasses and electronics are always affected
Lightning strikes always cause heavy damage

variant.question: Which of the following statements about lightnings and lightning strikes is correct?

options.text: The aircraft is temporarily part of the lightning trajectory.
Compasses and electronics are always affected.
Spherical lightnings often penetrate into aircraft.
Lightning strikes always cause heavy damage.

variant.question: What do you understand by "Saint Elmo's Fire"?

options.text: A bright blue or violet glow visible around the windscreen and external parts of the aircraft, occasionally seen when flying in the vicinity of thunderstorms.
A natural light display in the sky, caused by charged particles in the solar wind reacting with particles in the upper atmosphere.
A bright blue glow visible very briefly after a damaging lightning strike.
A natural light display in the sky, often seen by pilots flying at high altitude in Northern latitudes only.

variant.question: St Elmo`s fire near thunderstorms can be described as

options.text: an electric discharge from the aircraft caused by static build-up on the airframe.
the electric charge of the aircraft caused by air parcels over the wings and windscreen.
lightning from the top of a mature cumulonimbus cloud hitting the fuselage.
lightning in the horizontal plane in a cumulonimbus cloud hitting the wing tip.

variant.question: St Elmo`s fire near thunderstorms can be described as

options.text: an electric discharge from the aircraft caused by static build-up on the airframe
lightning from the top of a mature cumulonimbus cloud hitting the fuselage
the electric charge of the aircraft caused by air parcels over the wings and windscreen
lightning in the horizontal plane in a cumulonimbus cloud hitting the wing tip

variant.question: The development of lightning may be described as ...

options.text: a discharge of electricity due to the high electric potential between clouds and the Earth's surface.
the consequence of high sunspot activity in the ionosphere causing high electric potentials.
a decrease of potential energy between the Earth's surface and the base of clouds.
a result of increasing static electricity in areas where warm and cold air contact along a front.

variant.question:
Refer to figure. 
 What type of lightning is shown in the picture?

options.text: Cloud-to-ground
Cloud-to-cloud.
Intra-cloud.
Upward lightning

variant.question: Lightning is formed through an electrical charge

options.text: Between the ground and a thunderstorm cloud.
Between the tops or bases of two cumulonimbus clouds.
Between a warm, moist air mass and the colder surface.
Between two warm, moist air masses.

variant.question: Which description best describes the effect of a lightning strike on an aircraft and the consequences?

options.text: Most aircraft are considered to be “Faraday`s cages” and the impact of lightning strikes is minor, but in some cases structural damages may occur. The bright flash may also blind the pilot for 30 seconds or more.
The consequences of lightning strikes on aircraft in flight are not predictable. In many cases it results in accidents, sometimes with the total loss of the aircraft.
Water on the fuselage weakens the effect of the “Faraday`s cage” and may allow lightning to penetrate the aircrafts skin and to injure passengers.
Aircraft are “Faraday`s cages” and lightning has no effect on the structure of the aircraft. However the thunder may frighten some passengers.

variant.question: Which description best describes the effect of a lightning strike on an aircraft and the consequences?

options.text: Most aircraft are considered to be “”Faraday`s cages”” and the impact of lightning strikes is minor, but in some cases structural damages may occur. The bright flash may also blind the pilot for 30 seconds or more.”
“Water on the fuselage weakens the effect of the “”Faraday`s cage”” and may allow lightning to penetrate the aircrafts skin and to injure passengers.”
The consequences of lightning strikes on aircraft in flight are not predictable. In many cases it results in accidents, sometimes with the total loss of the aircraft.
“Aircraft are “”Faraday`s cages”” and lightning has no effect on the structure of the aircraft. However the thunder may frighten some passengers.”

variant.question: Aircraft struck by lightning may sometimes get considerable damage and at least temporarily the manoeuvring of the aircraft will be made more difficult. Which one of the following statements is correct?

options.text: Aircraft made by composite material may get severe damage, the crew may be blinded and temporarily lose the hearing.
An aircraft made by metal has a certain capacity to attract a lightning, but the lightning will follow the surface and therefore no damage will be caused.

An aircraft has in the atmosphere the same qualities as a "Faraday's cage", which means that struck of lightning seldom occurs. But if it happens, the result will be an occasional engine failure. The crew may get a shock.
Aircraft made by composite material can't conduct a lightning and will therefore very seldom be struck.

variant.question: How is lightning formed?

options.text: Negative charges are carried by a lightning bolt discharging from the cloud towards the ground.
The presence of several thunderstorms in the same area is the main criterion.
Electrical charges travel from high obstacles to the flying aircraft after being in the vicinity of a TS.
Lightning strikes are mostly observed in fair-weather zones ahead of a warm front.

variant.question: In a thunderstorm the electrical discharges most commonly happen due to potential differences between..

options.text: the Earth`s surface and the cloud or between different parts of the cloud.
the top of the thunderstorm and the surrounding air at the same altitude.
two thunderstorms, of which one is developing and the other dissipating.
the Earth`s surface and noctilucent clouds in the mesosphere.

variant.question: Various types of lightning are associated with cumulonimbus clouds. Which of the following best describes intra-cloud lightning?

options.text: lightning embedded within a cloud that lights up as a sheet of luminosity during the flash.
flashes that extend out into the air around the storm but do NOT strike the ground.
long, horizontally travelling flashes, often seen on the underside of stratiform clouds.
a channel of negative charge which zigzags (moves erratically) downward, in roughly 50 m segments, in a forked pattern.

variant.question: The basic outline of the electric field in the atmosphere may give a potential difference between the Earth`s surface and the ionosphere of up to 500 kV caused by..

options.text: the global distribution of thunderstorms.
fair weather current flow.
the adiabatic process and the stability of the atmosphere.
the relative perihelion and aphelion of the Earth to the Sun.
